rows.text_1_facilitator: @data.characters.f3_mother.name has big hopes for her childrenâ€™s futures and she is making a plan:

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f3_mother.name has big hopes for her childrenâ€™s futures and she is making a plan:

character_1_text.eng: "I want the best future for my children, but I donâ€™t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. I should save, but that feels impossible!"

rows.character_1_text: "I want the best future for my children, but I donâ€™t know where to get the money. Loan sharks are dangerous and paying them back is so expensive. I should save, but that feels impossible!"
"My course is to make sure my children reach their dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"

character_1_text.eng: "My course is to make sure my children reach their dream of university. How can I save a lot of money with the little money I have?"

rows.character_1_text: "Hmm, maybe I can start with a plan. First, let me make a budget â€“ a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time â€“ I will even join a savings and loans group."

character_1_text.eng: "Hmm, maybe I can start with a plan. First, let me make a budget â€“ a plan for how I can save my money. Then I will save just a little bit of money at a time â€“ I will even join a savings and loans group."

rows.character_1_text: "I should also speak with my children to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but donâ€™t need."

character_1_text.eng: "I should also speak with my children to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but donâ€™t need."

rows.text_1_facilitator: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are five tips on how to make a savings plan for you and your child:

text_1_facilitator.eng: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are five tips on how to make a savings plan for you and your child:

section_1_text.eng:
Decide why you want to save money. These could include:
ğŸ˜” Preparing for emergencies
ğŸ Buying something nice for you or your child or do something fun as a family
ğŸ“– Planning for future big expenses like improvements on your home or for your childâ€™s education

section_2_text.eng:
ğŸš© Set a target amount that you want to save. 
ğŸ’° Look at your monthly budget and decide how much you can save each week and each month.

section_3_text.eng:
Consider the different ways to keep money safe for future use. These could include:
ğŸ”‘ Saving at a bank
ğŸ’š Keeping money safe at home
ğŸ’° Keeping money in a savings and loan group
ğŸŒ· Buying livestock like goats or cattle 
Decide which way of saving money would work best for the family.

section_4_text.eng: â— If you can try and save even a tiny amount for the future or for an emergency. This can make a big difference over time.

section_5_text.eng:
ğŸŒ± Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. 
ğŸ’› Think about whether there are places in your community that provide support.
